titleproper.value: Guide to the American Irish Citizens Committee for the Re-Election of Mayor William O'Dwyer Records <num>AIA 002</num>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: American Irish Citizens Committee for the Re-Election of Mayor William O'Dwyer Records

extent.value: in 1 manuscript box and 1 oversize folder

abstract.value: The American Irish Citizens Committee for the Re-Election of Mayor William O'Dwyer was formed in 1949 and grew out of a previous entity, the Mayo Men's Committee for the Election of O'Dwyer, Joseph, and Impelletteri.  O'Dwyer (1890-1964), a native of Bohola, County Mayo, Ireland, had been elected Mayor of New York in 1945.  His 1949 re-election ticket included City Council President Vincent R. Impellitteri and Comptroller Lazarus Joseph.  This collection includes reports, minutes, correspondence, financial records, press releases, advertisements, and other printed material generated by the Committee during the 1949 campaign.

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; <lb/>Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library <lb/>70 Washington Square South <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

Gift of Dorothy Hayden Cudahy in 1996. This collection was part of an accession of materials from Dorothy Hayden Cudahy, who was secretary of the committee and therefore kept the most complete records of its activities. The accession number associated with this gift is 1996.003
O'Dwyer, William (with Paul O'Dwyer). <emph render="italic">Beyond the Golden Door</emph>. Jamaica, NY: St. Johns University Press, 1987.

The collection consists of reports and minutes, correspondence, financial records, press releases, newspaper ads, radio scripts and printed material generated by the committee from registration week to Election Day, 1949. Of particular interest is the pamphlet <emph render="italic">This Is O'Dwyer</emph>, produced by the committee. Also included in this collection is a newspaper advertisement for the election of William O'Dwyer from his first mayoral campaign in 1945.
